Tutorial¶

Sampling ARGs¶

As a simple example, we will first simulate sample

data with msprime. We will then run arginfer on the simulated dataset.

The following code simulates a tree sequence and the sequences for a sample size of 10 and sequence length of 1e5.

import msprime
import os
ts_full = msprime.simulate(sample_size=10, Ne=5000,
                                        length=1e5,
                                        mutation_rate=1e-8,
                                        recombination_rate=1e-8,
                                        record_full_arg= True,
                                        random_seed=2)
ts_full.dump(os.getcwd()+"/out/"+"ts_full.args")

The output of this code is a tree sequence stored in "out/" directory under the name of ts_full.args.

We use the simulated ts_full.args as in input to arginfer. The following code takes the simulated data runs arginfer.

#.. comment:: To run arginfer, we cawe use arginfer to take ts_full.args and

pip install -i https://test.pypi.org/simple/ arginfer
